intro: Erucastrum lamarckii, commonly known as the yellow horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its bright yellow petals and distinctive, horn-like seed pods. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sunlight. Its flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The species is part of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known poppies.
